meanings.definition: A unit of currency in Brunei, equal to 100 sen.
meanings.sent1: In Brunei, you can buy many things with just a few pulas.
meanings.sent2: I exchanged my dollars for Brunei pulas at the bank.
meanings.sent3: The pulas in my wallet jingled as I walked.
meanings.sent4: Her savings grew slowly, one pulas at a time.
meanings.sent5: The pulas felt light in my hand, but it held great value.

meanings.sent1: My heart pulas with excitement before a big race.
meanings.sent2: The drums pulas in the distance, signaling the start of the festival.
meanings.sent3: The music made my heart pulas in time with the rhythm.
meanings.sent4: The rain pulas on the roof like a soothing lullaby.
meanings.sent5: His footsteps pulas on the wooden floor, echoing through the empty house.

meanings.definition: To remove the husk or shell from a fruit or seed.
meanings.sent1: She carefully pulas the coconut to reveal the white flesh inside.
meanings.sent2: The farmer pulas the corn husks before selling them at the market.
meanings.sent3: I pulas the banana quickly, eager to eat the sweet fruit.
meanings.sent4: The chef pulas the almonds for the dessert, leaving them perfectly bare.
meanings.sent5: With skilled hands, she pulas the pomegranate, revealing the juicy seeds within.
